page.title: 06Amenities.
page.content: Bruton has its own playing field, where the town football and cricket clubs play throughout the year. Also on the site is the local youth club, as well as an adventure playing area for the younger children. In the town are branches of the Boy Scouts and Girl Guides, the Royal British Legion and the Women's Institute. The Church Rooms are the centre for most of their activities. The Ward Library is run by Somerset County Council, and is well stocked for a small library; it includes a small reading room, where displays are mounted regularly. The Parish Council meets every month, whilst the local Chamber of Commerce has been reformed recently to promote trade in the town. The recently completed flkood aleviation scheme also includes provision for a riverside walk.
